paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various mutations in the TTR gene associated with amyloidosis, particularly focusing on their effects on protein stability and dynamics.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: V30, with four different mutations in this position and with Zi = −1.17, has been identified as one of the most prominent familial amyloid polyneuropathy mutation.

functional_data.summary: Mutations in TTR lead to destabilization of the tetramer, increasing amyloid fibril formation.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M mutation is one of the most studied in relation to TTR amyloidosis.
key_quotes: V30, with four different mutations in this position and with Zi = −1.17, has been identified as one of the most prominent familial amyloid polyneuropathy mutation.

tables_processed.table_caption: Key position residues selected as those ranked with the lowest 10% values of Zi.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variants.
